title: Sudden login error on local machine (doccano installed using pip)
body:
Login details suddenly not working on local machine
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

I installed doccano using pip instead of using the docker. It has been working fine since but suddenly I am now unable to login to http://127.0.0.1:8000/. It shows incorrect username and password. 

I tried to create another user using "doccano createuser --username admin --password pass" as suggested in the Github page and it is able to login this new user created but I need to retrieve the work I've already done through my old username and password...

Any idea what's gone wrong? Or how I can retrieve the work I've done? Is it version problems maybe? 
(I looked at other similar issues but most relate to doccano installed using docker or heroku etc.) 

<!--
Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: Mac OS X (10.14.6) / ios
*   Python Version Used: Python 3.8.2
*   When you install doccano: 
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): pip install doccano
